intro: Muscarella villosilabia, commonly known as the hairy-labied muscaria, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Muscarella villosilabia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
